cyclone.name: GORDON
cyclone.current_location: about 275 miles ESE of Marathon, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking WNW across the Florida Keys Monday, then northwest over the eastern Gulf toward the central Gulf Coast (southeast Louisiana – Mississippi/Alabama coast) by Wednesday.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Gulf Coast near the southeast Louisiana to Mississippi coastline

port.name: Port of Greater Baton Rouge, LA

weather_observation.watch_coast: Alabama–Florida border westward to east of Morgan City, Louisiana, including Lake Pontchartrain and Lake Maurepas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central Gulf Coast from the Florida Panhandle westward to southeast Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force gusts (39–57 mph) possible Wednesday into early Thursday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected at the inland port site, though lower Mississippi River water levels could briefly rise from Gulf surge pushing upriver.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain bands could bring 2–4+ inches with locally higher totals Wednesday–Thursday, causing flash-flood concerns and operational slow-downs.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornado threat in outer rainbands; increased river current and floating debris affecting vessel movements.
